definition: to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

sentences.english: Why don't you practise what you preach?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么不躬行已言呢？

sentences.english: There is a bow at the end of the ponytail.
sentences.chinese: 在马尾辫末尾变成躬行。

sentences.english: In physically conducting myself as a gentleman, however, I have not accomplished anything as yet.
sentences.chinese: 作为躬行实践的君子，那么我还没有做到。

sentences.english: It reminds me how important it is to practice what I preach.
sentences.chinese: 这提醒我躬行己说的重要。

definition: to carry out (obligation) conscientiously/to behave sincerely
a sage/wise and holy man/virtuous ruler/Buddhist lama/wine
to study the underlying principle to acquire knowledge (idiom); pursuing knowledge to the end
to regulate the family and rule the state (idiom)
